# rlR: Reinforcement learning in R

## Installation
```{r}
# devtools::install_github("smilesun/rlR", dependencies = TRUE)
```

## Usage
```{r}
library(rlR)
env = makeGymEnv("MountainCar-v0", ok_step = 100, ok_reward = 195)
# Define success to be the last 100 episodes having an average rewards of 195
listAvailAgent()
```

```{r}
library(keras)
model = keras_model_sequential()
model %>% layer_dense(units = 8, activation = 'relu', input_shape = c(2)) %>%
  layer_dropout(rate = 0.25) %>%
  layer_dense(units = 2, activation = 'linear');model$compile(loss = 'mse', optimizer = optimizer_rmsprop(lr = 1e-3))
model
```



```{r fig.path="inst/figures"}

agent = makeAgent("AgentDQN", env)

agent$customizeBrain(model)

system.time({
 perf = agent$learn(30)  # to let travis pass, could not set too much iteration
})
 perf$plot()
```
